headline.main: THE MONEY CRISIS.; Theodore Parker on the Present Commercial Difficulties.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rev. THEODORE PARKER preached yesterday, at the music Hall, a "Sermon of hard Times," which was listened to by one of the largest congregations ever assembled in that spacious Hall. He took his text from 7th Ecclesiastes, 14th verse--"In the day of adversity consider." He commenced by saying that it was the duty of the man of science to interpret the world of matter to other men, and tell the meaning and use of things;

docs.lead_paragraph: A year ago this time they were turning out some 300 a day newly-naturalized citizens at the. Naturalization-Office in the City Hall, Now they are making but about 15 a day, notwLthstanding the near approach of election. To get out one's first papers there is a charge of a quarter: for the second they charge fifty cents.

headline.main: The Telegraph Cable--Dispatch from Capt. Hudson. From the Washington States, Saturday.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Washington States, Saturday. Interesting particulars in regard to the plans of the Atlantic Telegraph Company will be found in the following dispatch morning received at the Navy Department, from Captain HUDSON; U.S. STEAM-FRIGATS NIAGARA, KEYHAN DOCKYARD, PLYMOUTH, Thursday, Sept. 17. 1857.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. CHARLES MATHEWS took his farewell benefit at the Broadway Theatre last evening, prior to his departure for Boston. He appeared in three pieces--as Marplot, in the "Busy Body;" as Charles Beesuing in "Twenty Minutes with a Tiger;" and as Brownsmith in his own farce of "Little Toddlekins." To say that his acting was inimitable is simply to repeat the verdict that an immense and very enthusiastic audience accorded.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival at this port yesterday, of the Cunard steamship Arabia, we received London and Liverpool advices to the 19th ult.--three days later than those brought to St. Johns, N. B., by the Jura, and published in our impression of Tuesday Inst. The London journals notice extensively the financial reverses that have lately overtaken us.

headline.main: Lord Brougham's Lecture--Good Advice to Working Man.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lord BROUGHAM delivered an address recently at the meeting of the Mechanics' Association at Manchester, from which we make the following interesting and instructive extract: " I am about to address a few words partly to the working men themselves-those classes from which come the pupils who have been rewarded this evening, and partly to the employers of those classes and the patrons and supporters of these in. stitutions. docs.lead_paragraph: The Buston Gazette tells this story of business sagacity: One day during the past week a firm gave it check to one of their creditors for two thousand dollars, which he presented at the bank, where he was informed that it was drawn for five hundred dollars more than stood to the firm's credit.

headline.main: NEWS FROM DR. BURDELL.; Sworn Statement from the Doctor Himself as to the manner of his Death.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following remarkable developments regarding the murder of Doctor HARVEY BURDELL, have been published in the News Letter through a spiritual source. The interviews took place at three several times, at intervals of six weeks, to test his recollection of facts. It will be seen that the narrative is in the form of an affidavit, and we assure our readers there is no humbug about it. let the lovers of the marvelous read:
